Ingredients.1: 1 (7.25 ounce) package macaroni and cheese mix

Ingredients.7: 4 cups peanut oil for frying, or as needed

Ingredients.14: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste

Directions.1: Fill a pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Stir in macaroni, and return to a boil. Cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally until macaroni is cooked through but still firm to the bite, about 7 minutes. Drain. Stir in butter, 1/4 cup milk, and cheese packet from the macaroni and cheese package.

Directions.2: While macaroni is still hot, stir in Cheddar cheese, pimento cheese spread, and Italian cheese blend, and continue to stir until melted.

Directions.3: Place the macaroni and cheese mixture into a container and refrigerate until firm, about 4 hours.

Directions.4: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Remove the macaroni mixture from the refrigerator, and using a cookie scoop, scoop into balls. Place mac balls on the prepared baking sheet and freeze for at least 2 hours.

Directions.5: Heat oil in a deep fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Directions.6: Make a breading station: Whisk bread crumbs with paprika, chili powder, black pepper, sugar, salt, and cayenne in a shallow dish; set aside. Beat eggs with 3 tablespoons milk in a small bowl. Remove the mac balls from the freezer, coat in egg mixture, and then dredge in breading.

Directions.7: Fry the mac balls in hot oil in small batches until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Drain briefly on a paper towel-lined plate; serve hot.
